definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: The sight was so horrible that Laura changed colour from fear.
sentences.chinese: 这景象如此可怕，劳拉不由大惊失色。

sentences.english: When she discovered her baby had disappeared, she was greatly frantic.
sentences.chinese: 她发现孩子不见了，大惊失色。

sentences.english: Mother paled with shock at the news.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈听到那消息大惊失色。

sentences.english: Damocles looked up and saw that the sword when alarmed.
sentences.chinese: 达摩克利斯抬头望见这把利剑时，大惊失色。

sentences.english: They were alarmed to find her dead.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现她死了，大惊失色。

sentences.english: They were alarmed to find the old lady dead.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现老太太死了，大惊失色。

sentences.english: She paled with shock at the news.
sentences.chinese: 她听到那消息后大惊失色。

definition: to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
in a great rush/in a flurry
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
